Articles.Content:
Now that 1.0 has been announced i know this wont be implemented, that is why this is a discussion not a suggestion.

Anyway if you are like me and you dont play career because;

- Its Boring
- Its Repetitive

But you like the idea of;

- Contracts
- Money
- Reputation

And you dont like having to collect science.

Then this is the thread for you! 

How i would of liked career mode to be is this.

Features;

- Funds
- Reputation
- Contracts
- All parts available at the start
- Sandbox and Career together

This would of been great you would be able to do what you do in sandbox but with a budget.

Contracts more like.

- Save stranded Kerbal from surface, space, etc.
- Prevent asteroid from hitting kerbin
- The colonies and space station stuff

Essentially it would be career but with more freedome to create craft and no having to collect science to unlock parts.

Do you like this idea or not, Discuss below.

Some rules;

1. Forum Rules
2. Respect peoples Opinion
3. Dont make fun of peoples opinions

I would LOVE to have a career without money or science. i love being able to select a mission and do it, but i honestly couldnt care less about the rest of it (as im a pre-career mode player, and i build alot of sci-fi craft, that have no place in stock career).

Anyways, i support career without part limits (and for myself id love the sandboxy career to just allow us to have contracts/missions but nothing else.

I like collecting science. I prefer that to having to complete a bunch of contracts to collect funds. The next time I start a new game it will likely be a Science game rather than a Career game. But, hey, that's just me.

BTW, it's would have or would've, not would of.

A quadrillion times yes!!!!!

I want this!

SO

BAD!

What they really need to do is just make a "Custom" game option. Allow the player to pick and choose which features to include, and then allow the usual difficulty settings after the initial choices are made. This would allow for the most flexibility. Mix and match and take only the features you care about. You could have funds + contracts, but skip upgradable buildings.
